isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: ROCKWELL - DISASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: WHEELS, DRUMS AND HUBS FROM AXLE

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or tip over and cause injury.

step1.para: Jack up the vehicle under the axle being serviced.
Install jack stands under each corner of the vehicle to hold it in position.
Retract the brake linings with the brake adjustment so that the drums will clear the linings.
Remove the oil drain plug to drain the lubricant from the axle.

note.para: Do not remove the wheel (rim and tire) at this time.

step1.para: Remove the capscrews and washers to disassemble the hub cap, if used, and the drive flange from the wheel hub ( Figure 3).

figure.caption: Figure 3. Removing Hub Cap and Drive Flange

note.para: To loosen the drive flange from the hub, hit the flange with a soft mallet.

warning.para: Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause injury. Do not pry off the parts with a sharp tool. Damage to the mounting surfaces can occur.

step1.para: Remove the outer wheel bearing nut, lock washer and the inner wheel bearing nut from the spindle. Use the correct size wrench socket to prevent damage to the adjusting nuts ( Figure 4).

Pull the hub, drum and wheel assembly straight off the spindle. Use the tire to hold on to and pull. If necessary, hit the inside of the wheel with a mallet to loosen it. Be careful that the outer bearing cone does not fall when the hub is removed.
